description: R package for integrating numerical omics data that allows multiform graph representations to study molecular interaction networks.
name: CoNI

metadata.abstract: Today's immense growth in complex biological data demands effective and flexible tools for integration, analysis and extraction of valuable insights. Here, we present CoNI, a practical R package for the unsupervised integration of numerical omics datasets. Our tool is based on partial correlations to identify putative confounding variables for a set of paired dependent variables. CoNI combines two omics datasets in an integrated, complex hypergraph-like network, represented as a weighted undirected graph, a bipartite graph, or a hypergraph structure. These network representations form a basis for multiple further analyses, such as identifying priority candidates of biological importance or comparing network structures dependent on different conditions.
metadata.title: Correlation-guided Network Integration (CoNI), an R package for integrating numerical omics data that allows multiform graph representations to study molecular interaction networks
